reviewText: This movie is a funny WW II spoof and unmistakably Blake Edwards.  It has a female impersonator, water gags and all the elements usually found in his movies.  Henry Mancini provides great music.  Henry Morgan should have had a better character roll.  I would rather not have military overtones in movies.
summary: What Did You Do in the War, Daddy?
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a very funny movie.  Director Blake Edwards has fun with World War II.  Dick Shawn, one of the most under appreciated comedians in the movies is very funny as Captain Cash.  He is sent to capture an Italian town.  The Italian commander is willing to surrender if they can have a festival first. They have a festival and things start to go sideways. There is a fake battle, Nazi's show up, and there are people running through catacombs and communists who what the Nazi commander.  Harry Morgan, who was colonel Potter on MASH is Major Pott and he slowly goes crazy as he gets lost in the Catacombs beneath the City.  James Coburn is very good and along with Aldo Ray keep the story going.  I enjoyed this movie when it first came out and waited a long time for the DVD.  It was worth the wait.
summary: What did you do in the War Daddy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I remember seeing this film back in my high school days and laughing my butt off. Although some critics dismissed this film as an insult to three countries I thourly enjoyed it. No it isn't P.C. but who cares. It simply takes a funny situation to the level of absurdity. So watch and enjoy
summary: what did you do in the war daddy
Title: N/A

reviewText: This one-joke movie about the Italian Army's intestinal fortitude in engaging the war is tough going particularly when you consider the film's nearly two hour running time.  It's certainly watchable but doesn't deliver the chuckles one would expect.  It's nothing more than an extended episode of "McHale's Navy" with less laughs.  I'd say "Hogan's Heroes" but that show was repugnant.  Lone saving graces are a charming, not to say voluptuous, Giovanna Ralli and an all too brief turn by Carroll O'Connor as a gruff general.  Mildly shocking when you consider the involvement of director Blake Edwards and screenwriter William Peter Blatty ("The Exorcist").
summary: Did Somebody Order a Laugh Exorcist?
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is probably one of the funniest movies I've seen.  I first viewed this film when it was first released and have watched it several times since.  It actually gets better each viewing.  The movie was a sort of sleeper and probably has not gotten the recognition it deservies.  If you can find a copy, either VHS or DVD, I would strongly suggest you add it to your collection.  It is absolutely hilarious, the acting is excellent and the story will stick with you.  Highly recommend.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an amusing time killer with James Coburn playing James Coburn. Great if you like that character. He is simply not trying too much here. This movie feels like its as long as the campaign in Italy. The comedy feels forced. I just cannot fully recomend this if you looking for a James Coburn movie. Dick Shawn is not up to his usual caliber either and the part with Henry Morgan (of Col. Potter fame from MASH TV) is wasted as is Carol O'Conner. Try and catch it on TV unless a Coburn fan.
summary: For the Afternoon only, Not a whole War
Title: N/A

reviewText: This 1966 comedy looks fantastic on this May 2008 DVD release of this classic comedy. The format is anamorphic widescreen, enhanced for 16x9 aspect ratio, large-screen TVs. The picture and sound are crystal clear--beautiful rich, natural colors, sharp and crisp picture quality--it probably did not look this good in the movie theaters.  If you have a large-screen, high-definition TV/high-defintion DVD player with surround sound--you will not be disappointed.  Highly recommended!

reviewText: A wonderful, but forgotten cross between Kelly's Heroes & Hogan's Heroes set in 1943 Italy...complete with a bank heist! Why isn't this on DVD? KH and HH fans should give this a try.
summary: A cross between Kelly's Heroes & Hogan's Heroes...
